text: Yves Dreyfus (born May 17, 1931, in Clermont, France) is a French epee fencer who holds two medals as part of the French Olympic épée team. ==Biography== He was born in Clermont-Ferrand, France, and is Jewish.Yves Dreyfus - Auteur - Ressources de la Bibliothèque nationale de FranceYves Dreyfus Bio, Stats, and Results | Olympics at Sports-Reference.comDay by Day in Jewish Sports History - Bob WechslerEncyclopedia of Jews in Sports - Bernard Postal, Jesse Silver, Roy SilverJews and the Olympic Games: sport: a springboard for minorities - Paul Yogi Mayer He survived the Nazi occupation of France as a child despite being Jewish by taking the name Yves Doucet."Yves Dreyfus et escrime" Dreyfus was a three-time Olympian for France, and won two bronze medals.Yves DREYFUS - Olympic Fencing | France At the 1956 Olympics in Melbourne at the age of 25 he won a bronze medal in team epee. At the 1960 Olympics in Rome at the age of 29 he came in 6th in individual epee and tied for 9th with the French epee team. At the 1964 Olympics in Tokyo at the age of 33 he fenced in the individual epee and won a bronze medal in the team epee.Sports Around the World: History, Culture, and Practice In 1964 he won the French national championship in epee.Dreyfus, Yves : Jews In Sports @ Virtual Museum He won a gold medal in individual epee at the 1961 Maccabiah Games. He competed for France at the 1965 Maccabiah Games.The Times from Shreveport, Louisiana on August 22, 1965 · Page 41Jewish Post 12 March He won gold medals in both individual epee and team epee at the 1977 Maccabiah Games. In 1966, he was decorated by General Charles de Gaulle. In 1967, he was given the National Order of Merit by the French Council of Ministers.The Wisconsin Jewish Chronicle from Milwaukee, Wisconsin on September 29, 1967 · Page 17 He later became a Master of Arms.Succès renouvelé pour le tournoi à l’épée - Cournon-d'Auvergne (63800) - La Montagne ==See also== *List of select Jewish fencers ==Further reading== * * ==References== ==External links== *Jews in Sports bio *Jewish Olympic Medalists *List of Jewish Fencers Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:French male fencers Category:French épée fencers Category:Jewish fencers Category:Jewish French sportspeople Category:Olympic fencers of France Category:Fencers at the 1956 Summer Olympics Category:Fencers at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Fencers at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic bronze medalists for France Category:Olympic medalists in fencing Category:Maccabiah Games medalists in fencing Category:Maccabiah Games gold medalists for France Category:Competitors at the 1961 Maccabiah Games Category:Competitors at the 1965 Maccabiah Games Category:Competitors at the 1977 Maccabiah Games Category:Medalists at the 1956 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Clermont-Ferrand
